content:
Diagnosis:		Bilateral breast cancer - right T4b basal-like carcinoma with multiple lung metastases

Management:		12/2023 Right mastectomy
			01/2024 Commenced pembrolizumab/nab-paclitaxel
			03/2024 Cycle 3 discontinued due to progressive disease

Biomarkers:		Triple negative, PDL1 90%, TILs 80%

Current Situation:	Progressive disease with new lung nodules

[redacted name] attended urgent review today following concerning CT findings. She reports worsening breathlessness over past 2 weeks, now requiring 2L oxygen at rest. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3. Recent CT chest shows multiple new pulmonary nodules and increase in existing metastases despite 3 cycles of immunotherapy/chemotherapy. Her weight has dropped by 4kg since last review.

Given clear evidence of disease progression and declining performance status, we have discussed transitioning to palliative care focus. I have made urgent referral to palliative care team and arranged community oxygen assessment. We will hold further systemic therapy. Patient and family are in agreement with plan.

Plan:			Urgent palliative care review
			Community oxygen assessment
			Follow up in 2 weeks with palliative team

cancer_timeline.value: Cycle 3 discontinued due to progressive disease
CT shows multiple new pulmonary nodules and increase in existing metastases

patient_facts.value: Worsening breathlessness requiring 2L oxygen at rest
Weight loss of 4kg since last review

status_updates.value: Advanced bilateral breast cancer with progressive lung metastases. Disease progression on immunotherapy/chemotherapy with significant clinical deterioration
Progressive disease with new and enlarging lung metastases on CT
Discontinuing systemic therapy due to disease progression and poor performance status
Deterioration in performance status to ECOG 3 with new oxygen requirement
Urgent palliative care referral and follow up in 2 weeks with palliative team
